author: xtqqczze

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body:
This pull request has been automatically marked as Review Needed because it has been there has not been any activity for **7 days**.
Maintainer, please provide feedback and/or mark it as `Waiting on Author`

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
I'm seeing warnings on the following pattern in live analysis, I'm surprised CI did not fail:

`SA1000: The keyword 'new' should be followed by a space.`

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/db94377b3a69511280d329e64375475f6d7513b8/src/Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.CimCmdlets/RemoveCimInstanceCommand.cs#L288

This issue was fixed in DotNetAnalyzers/StyleCopAnalyzers#3187, and is in the [v1.2.0-beta.261](https://github.com/DotNetAnalyzers/StyleCopAnalyzers/releases/tag/1.2.0-beta.261) release.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> I'm surprised CI did not fail:

CI makes clean loading packages. So I guess if you see the warning you need clean your local package cache.

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
> > I'm surprised CI did not fail:
> 
> CI makes clean loading packages. So I guess if you see the warning you need clean your local package cache.

CI is now failing

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
> > @SteveL-MSFT @TravisEz13 those build errors are coming from files I haven't touched in this PR. Not sure what's up there, I'm guessing something got merged that for some reason managed not to trigger the build errors but should have?
> 
> Yeah I'm not able to build this branch locally either.
> 
> Looks like it's coming from [these](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Amerged+IDE0090), but checks for those PRs passed.
> 
> Looking into how best to fix (and ideally prevent from reoccurring).
> 
> /cc @iSazonov

_Originally posted by @rjmholt in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/9900#issuecomment-736030665_

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
Between tests for this PR passing (12 days ago), we merged [IDE0090](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Amerged+IDE0090) PRs, which conflicted as the version of StyleCopAnalyzers in use at the time did not support target-typed new expressions properly. 

We could reduce the likelihood of similar issues occurring again by running tests again between approval and merge.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> We could reduce the likelihood of similar issues occurring again by running tests again between approval and merge.

Ah, clear! We catch this again :-)
